title: Analysis of Market Trends and Competitiveness of the Camelid Livestock Value Chain in the North of Chile
content: The Integrated Territorial Program (ITP) for the development of camelid livestock faces key challenges, such as low productivity and lack of infrastructure in the region. This program is aligned with the Territorial Agenda for Agricultural Innovation (FIA) and the Sustainable Development Goals of the 2030 Agenda, prioritizing camelid livestock farming in Chile's highlands as a strategic productive resource. The methodology used is based on co-creation with stakeholders in the territory and comparative analysis to improve competitiveness. This document highlights the relevance of the ITP in a volatile and constantly changing global environment, and its contribution to the innovation and competitiveness of camelid livestock in the Arica and Parinacota region.
